planner

Class Venue

  • java.lang.Object
    • planner.Venue

  • public class Venue
extends java.lang.Object

    An immutable class representing a venue in the municipality.

    A venue has a name and a capacity. The capacity of the venue is an integer greater than zero that represents the maximum number of people who can attend the venue at the same time for an event. A venue can only host events with a size less than or equal to its capacity.

    Hosting an event at a venue generates traffic on some traffic corridors in the municipality.

    The amount of traffic that is generated on each corridor is - except for integer truncation - linearly proportional to the size of the event: if an event of maximum size C for the venue would generate traffic X on a corridor, then an event of size K would generate (K*X)/C traffic on that corridor. (Note that the integer division truncates the decimal places of the division.)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Venue(java.lang.String name, int capacity, Traffic capacityTraffic)
      Creates a new venue with the given name, and capacity, that generates the traffic described by parameter capacityTraffic for an event of size capacity at the venue.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      boolean canHost(Event event)
      Returns true if the size of the event is less than or equal to the capacity of the venue, and false otherwise.
      boolean checkInvariant()
      Determines whether this class is internally consistent (i.e.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
      Returns true if and only if the given object (i) is an instance of the class Venue (ii) with a name that is equal to this venue's name (according to the equals method of the String class), (iii) a capacity that is equal to this venue's capacity and (iv) generates the same traffic as this venue for an event of maximum size (capacity) at the venue.
      int getCapacity()

      int hashCode()
      Produces a hashcode based on the venue name, capacity, corridors with traffic and the traffic in those corridors.
      java.lang.String toString()
      The string representation of a venue is a string of the form

      "NAME (CAPACITY)" + LINE_SEPARATOR + "CAPACITYTRAFFIC"

      where NAME is the name of the venue, CAPACITY is the capacity of the venue, LINE_SEPARATOR is the line separator retrieved in a machine-independent way by calling System.getProperty("line.separator"), and CAPACITYTRAFFIC is the toString() representation of the Traffic object describing the traffic generated by hosting an event of size capacity at the venue.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Venue

        public Venue(java.lang.String name,
             int capacity,
             Traffic capacityTraffic)
        Creates a new venue with the given name, and capacity, that generates the traffic described by parameter capacityTraffic for an event of size capacity at the venue.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the venue
        capacity - the capacity of the venue
        capacityTraffic - the traffic generated by hosting an event of size capacity at the venue
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either name or capacityTraffic are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if capacity is less than or equal to zero.
        InvalidTrafficException - if the traffic on any corridor described by capacityTraffic is greater than the capacity of the venue (i.e. you can't generate more traffic for a corridor than you have people at the venue.)

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        Returns the name of the venue.

        the name of the venue

        public int getCapacity()
        Returns the capacity of the venue.

      • canHost

        public boolean canHost(Event event)
        Returns true if the size of the event is less than or equal to the capacity of the venue, and false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        event - the event whose compatibility with this venue will be checked
        Returns:
        true iff the capacity of the venue is greater than or equal to the size of the event.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if event is null

      • getTraffic

        public Traffic getTraffic(Event event)

        Returns the amount of traffic that would be generated by hosting the given event at this venue.

        For each corridor c, the traffic generated by the event on that corridor is defined to be the integer ((K * X) / C), where K is the size of the event, C is the capacity of this venue and X is the traffic generated by an event of size C at this venue on corridor c.

        (This definition means that the amount of traffic that is generated on each corridor is - except for the integer truncation - linearly proportional to the size of the event.)

        Parameters:
        event - the event for which the traffic will be generated
        Returns:
        the traffic generated by hosting the given event at this venue
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if event is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the size of the event exceeds the capacity of the venue

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        The string representation of a venue is a string of the form

        "NAME (CAPACITY)" + LINE_SEPARATOR + "CAPACITYTRAFFIC"

        where NAME is the name of the venue, CAPACITY is the capacity of the venue, LINE_SEPARATOR is the line separator retrieved in a machine-independent way by calling System.getProperty("line.separator"), and CAPACITYTRAFFIC is the toString() representation of the Traffic object describing the traffic generated by hosting an event of size capacity at the venue.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
        Returns true if and only if the given object (i) is an instance of the class Venue (ii) with a name that is equal to this venue's name (according to the equals method of the String class), (iii) a capacity that is equal to this venue's capacity and (iv) generates the same traffic as this venue for an event of maximum size (capacity) at the venue. (The amount of traffic generated is the same if it is the same according to the sameTraffic() method of the Traffic class).
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Produces a hashcode based on the venue name, capacity, corridors with traffic and the traffic in those corridors.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the hashcode of the corridor object

        public boolean checkInvariant()

        Determines whether this class is internally consistent (i.e. it satisfies its class invariant).

        NOTE: This method is only intended for testing purposes.

        Returns:
        true if this class is internally consistent, and false otherwise.
